name: Avocado Omelette
description: Fluffy eggs folded around creamy avocado and sautéed spinach for a rich, low-carb breakfast.
steps: Whisk the eggs in a bowl with salt and pepper until well combined.
Heat the olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat and sauté the spinach until just wilted.
Pour the eggs into the pan and cook, gently lifting the edges so uncooked egg flows underneath.
Arrange the sliced avocado on one half, fold the omelette over, cook 1 more minute, then slide onto a plate.

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
description: Creamy Greek yogurt layered with berries, honey, and crunchy granola for a quick high-protein breakfast.
steps: In a small bowl, stir the yogurt with vanilla extract if using.
Spoon half of the yogurt into a glass or bowl, then add half of the berries and half of the granola.
Repeat with the remaining yogurt, berries, and granola.
Drizzle honey over the top and serve immediately.

name: Overnight Chia Pudding
description: Creamy chia pudding soaked overnight in almond milk, topped with fresh fruit for a grab-and-go breakfast.
steps: In a jar or small container, whisk together almond milk, chia seeds, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Stir well, then let sit for 5 minutes and stir again to prevent clumping.
Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours, preferably overnight, until thickened.
Top with fresh fruit just before serving.

name: Mediterranean Scramble
description: Soft scrambled eggs with tomatoes, spinach, and feta cheese, inspired by Mediterranean flavors.
steps: Whisk the eggs with salt and pepper in a medium bowl.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, then add tomatoes and cook 2–3 minutes until softened.
Stir in the spinach and cook until wilted.
Pour in the eggs and gently scramble until just set, then fold in the feta before serving.

name: Tofu Veggie Skillet
description: A savory tofu scramble with colorful veggies that mimics scrambled eggs without dairy or meat.
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sauté onion and bell pepper until softened.
Crumble the tofu into the pan and stir in turmeric, garlic powder, and salt.
Cook for 4–5 minutes, stirring, until the tofu is heated through and slightly browned.
Stir in spinach and cook just until wilted, then serve warm.

name: Oatmeal Banana Bowl
description: Warm rolled oats topped with sliced banana and cinnamon for a cozy, fiber-rich breakfast.
steps: Combine oats, milk, and water in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Bring to a gentle simmer, stirring occasionally, until the oats are soft and creamy, 5–7 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl and top with sliced banana.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and drizzle with honey or maple syrup if desired.

name: Paleo Egg Muffins
description: Mini baked egg muffins loaded with veggies, perfect for meal prep and grab-and-go breakfasts.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and lightly grease a 6-cup muffin tin.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs with salt and pepper until well combined.
Stir in mushrooms, spinach, and bell pepper.
Pour the mixture into the muffin cups and bake for 18–20 minutes, or until set in the center.

name: Berry Smoothie Bowl
description: A thick berry smoothie served in a bowl and topped with crunchy seeds and fresh fruit.
steps: Add berries, banana, almond milk, oats, and chia seeds to a blender.
Blend until thick and smooth, adding a splash more milk if needed.
Pour into a bowl.
Top with extra fruit, nuts, or seeds and serve immediately.

name: Protein Pancakes
description: Fluffy pancakes made with oats, eggs, and yogurt for a protein-packed morning treat.
steps: Blend oats, eggs, banana, yogurt, baking powder, and cinnamon until smooth.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add a little butter or oil.
Pour small circles of batter into the pan and cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden.
Serve warm with fresh fruit or a drizzle of maple syrup.

name: Shakshuka
description: Eggs poached in a spiced tomato and pepper sauce, served with crusty bread for dipping.
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sauté onion and bell pepper until softened.
Add garlic, cumin, and paprika and cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, salt, and pepper, then simmer for 5–7 minutes until slightly thickened.
Make small wells in the sauce, crack in the eggs, cover, and cook until the whites are set but yolks are still runny.

name: Chicken Avocado Salad
description: Grilled chicken tossed with creamy avocado, crisp lettuce, and a zesty lime dressing.
steps: In a large bowl, combine lettuce, chicken, avocado, and cherry tomatoes.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad.
Toss gently to coat and serve immediately.

name: Quinoa Greek Bowl
description: A hearty bowl of quinoa with cucumber, tomato, olives, and feta for a classic Greek flavor profile.
steps: Add quinoa, cucumber, tomatoes, olives, and feta to a large bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, and salt.
Pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture.
Toss until everything is evenly coated and serve.

name: Lentil Veggie Stew
description: A comforting pot of lentils simmered with carrots, celery, and tomatoes for a filling vegan lunch.
steps: Heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat and sauté onion, carrots, and celery until slightly softened.
Add garlic and thyme and cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in lentils, crushed tomatoes, vegetable broth, and salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 25–30 minutes until lentils are tender.

name: Turkey Lettuce Wraps
description: Seasoned ground turkey served in crisp lettuce leaves for a light, protein-rich lunch.
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sauté onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add the ground turkey and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until no longer pink.
Stir in soy sauce and ginger, then cook another 2–3 minutes to let flavors meld.
Spoon turkey mixture into lettuce leaves and serve immediately.

name: Chickpea Buddha Bowl
description: Roasted chickpeas, sweet potato, and kale over rice with a creamy tahini drizzle.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss sweet potato cubes and chickpeas with 1 tbsp olive oil and half the salt.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast 20–25 minutes, stirring once, until golden.
Meanwhile, massage the kale with remaining 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt until slightly softened.
Whisk tahini, lemon juice, garlic powder, and a splash of water until pourable, then assemble bowls with rice, kale, roasted chickpeas, and sweet potato, drizzled with tahini sauce.

name: Zoodle Bolognese
description: Zucchini noodles topped with a hearty, meaty tomato sauce in a lighter take on classic bolognese.
steps: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add ground meat and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, Italian seasoning, and salt, then simmer 10–15 minutes.
Lightly sauté zucchini noodles in a separate pan for 1–2 minutes, then top with the bolognese sauce.

name: Caprese Quinoa Salad
description: Caprese-style salad with quinoa, tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil for extra protein and fiber.
steps: In a large bowl, combine quinoa, tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and salt.
Pour the dressing over the salad.
Toss gently and serve at room temperature or chilled.

name: Paleo Power Bowl
description: Roasted chicken served over broccoli and cauliflower rice with crunchy almonds.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss broccoli with 1 tbsp olive oil, garlic powder, and a pinch of salt.
Roast broccoli on a baking sheet for 15–20 minutes until tender and slightly browned.
In a skillet, heat remaining 1 tbsp olive oil and sauté cauliflower rice with a pinch of salt for 5–7 minutes.
Assemble bowls with cauliflower rice, roasted broccoli, sliced chicken, and chopped almonds.

name: Halloumi Grain Bowl
description: Pan-seared halloumi cheese served over a bed of grains and veggies with a lemony dressing.
steps: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sear halloumi slices until golden on both sides.
In a bowl, toss cooked grains with tomatoes and cucumber.
Whisk together remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, lemon juice, and oregano.
Top the grain bowl with halloumi and drizzle with the dressing.

name: Black Bean Burrito Bowl
description: A colorful burrito-style bowl with black beans, rice, corn, salsa, and avocado.

ingredients.name: Canned black beans, drained and rinsed

steps: Divide cooked rice between two bowls.
Top each bowl with black beans, corn, and salsa.
Add sliced avocado on top.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with lime wedges for squeezing over.

name: Grilled Salmon & Greens
description: Simply grilled salmon fillets served over a bed of garlicky sautéed greens.
steps: Brush salmon fillets with 1 tbsp olive oil and season with half the salt and pepper.
Grill or pan-sear salmon over medium-high heat for 3–4 minutes per side, until cooked through.
In a skillet, heat remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, then sauté garlic briefly before adding the greens.
Cook until wilted, season with remaining salt, squeeze lemon over the salmon, and serve on the greens.

name: Vegan Lentil Curry
description: A creamy coconut lentil curry with spinach, perfect served over rice or on its own.
steps: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat and sauté onion until softened.
Stir in curry paste or powder and cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Add lentils, coconut milk, vegetable broth, and salt, then bring to a simmer.
Cook 15–20 minutes until lentils are tender, then stir in spinach until wilted.

name: Chicken Fajita Bowls
description: Seasoned chicken strips with peppers and onions over rice, inspired by sizzling fajitas.
steps: Toss chicken, peppers, and onion with olive oil and fajita seasoning.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook the mixture until the chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Divide cooked rice among bowls.
Top with the chicken fajita mixture and add optional toppings like salsa or avocado.

name: Tofu Stir Fry
description: Crispy tofu cubes tossed with stir-fried broccoli and peppers in a simple soy-garlic sauce.
steps: Heat half the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and cook tofu cubes until golden on all sides, then remove from pan.
Add remaining oil, then stir-fry broccoli and bell pepper for 3–4 minutes.
Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute.
Return tofu to the pan, add soy sauce, and toss everything to coat before serving.

name: Turkey Meatballs with Zoodles
description: Baked turkey meatballs served on a bed of garlicky zucchini noodles with marinara sauce.
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). In a bowl, mix turkey, egg, almond flour, Italian seasoning, and salt.
Form small meatballs and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet, then bake 18–20 minutes until cooked through.
Meanwhile, sauté zucchini noodles in olive oil for 2–3 minutes until just tender.
Warm marinara sauce in a small pot, then serve meatballs and sauce over the zoodles.

name: Baked Cod with Herbs
description: Tender cod fillets baked with lemon, garlic, and fresh herbs for a light dinner.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Place cod fillets in a lightly greased baking dish.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Lay lemon slices over the fish.
Bake 12–15 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.

name: Steak & Roasted Veg
description: Pan-seared sirloin steak served with a tray of simple roasted vegetables.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss carrots and zucchini with 1 tbsp olive oil and half the salt and pepper.
Spread vegetables on a baking sheet and roast 20–25 minutes until tender.
Season steaks with remaining salt and pepper.
Heat remaining 1 tbsp olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and cook steaks to desired doneness, 3–5 minutes per side, then rest before serving with vegetables.

name: Veggie Pasta Primavera
description: Pasta tossed with peas, carrots, and a light Parmesan cream sauce.
steps: Cook pasta according to package directions, adding peas and carrots for the last 3 minutes of cooking.
Drain, reserving a small amount of pasta water.
Return pasta and vegetables to the pot and stir in butter, cream, and Parmesan over low heat.
Season with salt and loosen with reserved pasta water if needed.

name: Herbed Chicken Traybake
description: Chicken thighs baked on a single tray with potatoes and carrots, flavored with rosemary.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Place chicken, potatoes, and carrots on a large baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Toss vegetables to coat, then spread everything out in a single layer.
Bake 35–40 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender and browned.

name: Cauliflower Fried “Rice”
description: A low-carb fried rice made with cauliflower, peas, carrots, and scrambled egg.
steps: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add peas and carrots and cook 2–3 minutes, then stir in cauliflower rice and cook another 5 minutes.
Push the mixture to one side of the pan and pour beaten eggs into the empty side, scrambling until just set.
Stir everything together, add soy sauce, and top with green onions before serving.

name: Mushroom Risotto
description: Creamy Arborio rice cooked slowly with mushrooms, broth, and Parmesan cheese.
steps: Warm the broth in a small pot and keep it at a gentle simmer.
In a separate pan, sauté onions and mushrooms in butter or oil until softened.
Stir in Arborio rice and cook 1–2 minutes, then add a ladle of hot broth, stirring until absorbed.
Continue adding broth a ladle at a time, stirring, until rice is creamy and tender, then stir in Parmesan and season with salt.

name: Roasted Veg Couscous
description: Fluffy couscous tossed with roasted zucchini, eggplant, and peppers in a simple olive oil dressing.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss zucchini, eggplant, and bell pepper with 1 tbsp olive oil and half the salt.
Roast on a baking sheet for 20–25 minutes until tender and slightly caramelized.
Meanwhile, cook couscous according to package directions.
Fluff couscous with a fork, then toss with roasted vegetables, remaining olive oil, lemon juice, and remaining salt.

name: Garlic Shrimp Skillet
description: Juicy shrimp sautéed with garlic, lemon, and herbs, served with a side of veggies or salad.
steps: Pat the shrimp dry and season with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add shrimp and cook 1–2 minutes per side until pink and opaque.
Stir in garlic for the last minute of cooking, then remove from heat and toss with lemon juice and parsley.
